text: This place has some of the best food and drinks I've ever tasted.  The waitress Joy is sweet and very attentive.

The food was ok. Nothing spectacular. Ribs were tuff. My burger was good.  Service was awful. A 20 percent gratuity automatically given to these servers no matter what! Our server brought my husband wet naps and extra napkins when he had one rib left. Then she was never to be seen again. I had to leave my table to find her for my check. She did not deserve a tip. I work in a restaurant in RI and my girls would run circles around these servers with smiles on their faces. Management needs to step up. 
I'm an owner at Tahiti and here yearly so we figured we would give them another shot. This time we ordered pizza to go. A 4 item pizza. The bartender informed us they were out of peppers. Ok no problem. We get to our room. You could count the toppings and it was missing pepperoni! Yes, we were charged for 4 toppings. Lol. I don't think there will be a third visit.  
Oh how could I forget. The bartender was miserable.

The service was horrible, not even close to being worthy of the automatic 20% gratuity included.  After the waitress brought our food we didn't see her again. I had to go to the bar twice to ask for a drink refill before we received them. The grilled chicken sandwiches were cold.  I spoke to the manager and she didn't seem like she cared.

Visited twice this past weekend, both experiences were poor. They forget drinks and when you finally get your drinks they come in dirty glasses. Food quality is low, and they take forever.  40 minutes for an appetizer  is far too long.
Friendly staff, great bar selection & awesome food. Prices are more then reasonable. Locals, discover this gem!

Amazing food and atmosphere. Staff is great and the food is the best in town! Comfortable seating inside if you want to hang out and watch a game, gamble or just enjoy one of the MANY beers on tap. The patio is also a great place to lounge and overlook the lush landscaping and amazing pool.

Really? I see 4 stars and I have absolutely no idea how that's even possible. 20 percent tip is included so you have no recourse for the unfriendly, poor service. Don't ask for salt on the rim of your margarita unless you literally want the bartender to roll her eyes at you!

Went in for just bloody Mary's.  There was 4 of us bartender was not that great got the bill 20% tip already added. I tip well for great service. Not average service. They really need to take that off.
Chelsea was our server and she was amazing. she was fast energetic and charismatic. Thank you for the good food and great company!
It's all good. Tahiti Village is an oasis in Las Vegas. I can recommend the Chicken Quesadilla and the happy hour pricing. The hotel rooms are badass too

We are owners at Tahiti Village so we came down to get a takeout bite. When the weather is nice they have a lovely outdoor patio. When I arrived I had to run down the waitress but after I ordered it took no time to get the fish and chips which was excellently prepared cod. The fries were overcooked so I suggest the salad. We also ordered the carrot cake. It was not overly sweet so it was an excellent treat that was enough for two.
Nachos were cold and not restaurant quality. Fried fish tacos was burnt to a crisp-inedible. They said they were short staffed. The only reason we gave two stars is because they comped the meal.

Great concept but it misses the mark. The servers are not very motivated and the food was mediocre at best. I wish it was better because the menu is appealing and the location is perfect for all of the folks staying at Tahiti Village. We also ordered drinks. We found them to be just so so and not worth the $$$.
Happy hour ENDS at 5pm? I'm sooo confused! No appetizers on happy hour menu??? Mac n cheese bites were yummy and while not ordered onion rings were huge! Not the ambiance expected!

Food  and service were good, and my bill should have been $19, but when I went to pay, discovered the automatic tip of 20%, and tax.The bill was almost $25 for one drink and appetizer.

Not sure why this is not disclosed, --the food wasn't bad and tropical atmosphere was great, but may not be back because of this policy which applies to drinks as well.

Went to watch football Arizona game on Saturday night... THEY have a big sign that displays football happy hour... THEY wud not honor the happy hour cuz not Sunday football game... No where on sign did it advertise what football game... 
This business is a big SCAM!!!
Food was not good and a bit Pricy... Service was slow and not very helpful... I went there cuz I stood at Tahiti village resort and the highly recommended this place...
I say don't go unless you're tired and don't want to go away from resort.
VERY UNHAPPY WITH PLACE

About the place: casual ambiance, nice and very clean. The wait staff is very attentive and best of all they serve alcoholic drinks to go! The name is a bit cheesy and initially turned me off to it, but it's actually quite good. They also have a really nice patio poolside so you can enjoy your meals outdoors. 

About the food: typical bar food (which I enjoy). I had the chicken fingers both plain and tossed in buffalo sauce. They are good both ways and come with fries. The fries are just okay I would say. My brother had a good Cobb salad and my dad said the fish and chips was excellent. I believe it's a cod fish - supposedly not all places use cod and my dad says when it's served with cod it's better. 

About the prices: I think average probably for Vegas. It's in the Tahiti Resort Wyndham property. Good place and I'd go back!

My husband and I dined at 17 South Booze & Bites last week while our stay at the Tahiti Villages in Las Vegas. The restaurant is small, it has a nice outdoor area with TVs although it was way too hot to sit outside and eat. We sat next to the TVs inside away from the traffic of people. When we arrived to the restaurant we were greater right away and told we could sit wherever we would like. A bit confused when we first came in because there is not sign, it was nice that a waiter was there when we arrived. Within minutes we were greeted by our waiter, and were given a menu. Minutes after he arrived to take our order. The Passion Fruit Margarita I got was very good, the Pina Colada my husband got he loved. I order the lettuce cups, no shrimp or chicken (I'm Vegan) they were very very good! I was actually full which was nice. My husband got a burger with fries, I do not remember the name of it but it was rare the way he likes and he absolutely loved it. Overall the experience here was great. The staff was friendly, the prices are on point, the food was delicious, and atmosphere nice, and pretty touristy. The menu is slim so not many choice, but satisfying. I will be returning here in the near future on our upcoming stays.

Fantastic food, great atmosphere and excellent service! There is an amazing outdoor patio overlooking lush tropical landscaping and the resorts signature tropical pool. Loved the sliding glass doors that brought the outside in. Perfect place to grab a good bite and transport yourself to the tropics. It's like being on vacation. 

The bartenders are fantastic with 24 beers on tap and the food was great. Love the island ribs and the best hamburgers in the city!

We stayed at the Tahiti and went here a few times.  Lemon pepper chicken wings are delicious!  

The bartenders are super nice and I love that you get to play slots at the bar while waiting for your food.

We also had a cheeseburger and a chicken sandwich. Which was very, very good.

Very Newplace to grab sometbing too bite!!! People that work here are friendly. Plenty of TVs to watch sport got 2slot machine... food is great came here twice already and the fish and chips are so good.. so ifyour around the area swing by they areopen too public

Finally got to try the nachos and they were yummy! The ribs with waffle fries is a must! Waffle fries were well done and crunchy and the rib sauce was finger-lickin' good! Lovely restaurant in Tahiti Village with great food and great prices. We sat ourselves and had to ask for a server, but no biggie. All in all, definitely recommended! Oh, and 20% gratuity included in all bills.

Food tasted excellent especially the seasoned french fries. My children had the hamburgers and my wife and I eat the steak sandwich. My wife's steak was cook medium and it came out medium. I ordered med-rare and got it well-done. I told the server and he replaced it quickly with a positive attitude. I the replaced steak was delicious. I am still happy with restaurant because the problem was taken care of without the server being rude or disrespectful. I would eat there again and recommend it to others.
Gross, yuk, only ate here because we were staying at the hotel and my group was to lazy to go find food elsewhere.  If you are not already here, don't come.

Good service, not so good food. We were advised by the staff that the fish & chips were some of the best in town. We were very disappointed by the thick, tasteless Halibut bites. We ordered the 3 sliders for our kids to share which were good size and good in flavor. Their drinks were made well (I had a strawberry mojito) but overall for the price I wasn't too impressed.

Beautiful patio and the staff was very nice. Menu rather slim and our food was rather bland. Disappointed that they dont give TV owner a discount like Tahiti Joes did. We love the location of this new venue, but a $50+ lunch for two beers and two mediocre plates of food wasn't very appealing to us.

My family was staying at Tahiti Village so we just walked over from the pool. The burgers were delicious (17s & Jalape√±o). The service was terrible despite the restaurant having only 5 tables. Our food arrived and we asked for mayo and an iced tea refill. The redhead said that she would get it. At least 5 minutes passed, when another server (brunette with short hair) was at the station next to our table. We asked for the mayo and iced tea and she said, "oh let me find your server". We waited almost 10 minutes after for the items. By then two of us were finished with our burgers. In that whole time, our server didn't check to see if the food hit the table until she brought our items. So two of us enjoyed hot meals, the other two did not. :(

Food was great; service was terrible.

Great food... Terrible service!  Every meal tasted great and the mixed drinks were delicious but as soon as we would get our food or drinks, that was the last time we would see our server until we would "find" them and suggest we got our check after waiting half an hour on them.
This is the most horrible place I've been too. Service was terrible and the food bad. Stay away. I tipped the waitress $1 consideration for the wonderful service we experienced.

During our three night stay the first night was pleasant but it went downhill from there.  We are owners at the timeshare where this bar is located in and overall I was disappointed. It's a nice bar with decent food but we are definitely skeptical about the ethics of the staff. No where on the menu or anywhere else do they let you know that gratuity is included in your bill until you're paying the tab. On your final bill they are supposed to stamp in red ink so that you can see the gratuity was included. My friend's bill did not have that stamp and I was distracted and did not see it on mine and we both paid double gratuity. On the third day my husband was playing the poker game at the bar and wanted to cash out. The bartender is the cashier for the machines. The bartender thought my husband was too drunk to notice that he shorted him $40.  A stranger gaming next my husband was nice enough to jump in and back my husband up. In Las Vegas it seems everyone tries to take advantage of you.

Very nice staff and seating area. Two machines and video poker at the bar. All the food I saw go by looked great. My Asian chicken salad looked good but eh on taste. Very bitter greens and cold chicken. The hot wings were moist & good on flavor. Next time I will try the grilled cheese or sandwich. Salad needs work

My wife and I has been a patron for many times at Tahiti Village and for the first time we came to this establishment and was served by  JESSICA who performed her duties as a bartender in a friendly and professional manner. Considering the number of patrons at this establishment at this hour I see her as a hard working and a dedicated person doing her duties. Excellent help are very hard to find and KUDOS to the one who hired her. Customer service in my opinion received from JESSICA is excellent. GOOD JOB!!!
We ordered basic bar food for a quick bite.  Nachos were swimming in grease, fries had a burnt flavor, salad was somethung you could have made better at home.

Yvonne, the server, who was responsible for our first experience at this restaurant performed far beyond what we had expected to find. She was very pleasant, extremely efficient, and she made us feel like we were old friends. 
We eat at many restaurants and experience many servers, but Yvonne was seemed to be naturally warm and accommodating which made our meal more than just a dinner event but rather a pleasant eating experience with a caring friend.

Disappointing. We waited an hour and a half for a chicken sandwich and a pizza and our waitress checked on us once. Very poor service. We complained twice to other staff and our waitress still did not give us any updates. The restaurant was not busy (had maybe 8 tables sat) so there is just no excuse for the terrible service we were given.  Had a great experience had Tahiti village other than this awful restaurant. We got better service at the dennys next door than we did at this restaurant.

Shannon is the absolute best!  Honestly it's her personality that brings me back to the spot ok that and the fact that this is the restaurant on the property.  The food is alright nothing to write home about but to be fair I haven't tried their pizza yet.

This place has potential.  It's in a nice resort and the space is nice with a bar and a patio.  We came here twice while staying at the resort.  It's a "family resort" so I was suprised to learn that they do not have a kids menu. The regular menu pretty much reads like a kids menu- Chicken strips, cheese pizza, etc...so maybe that's why they don't have one.  The menu here is pretty limited and it's basic bar-type food.  I got the burger with bleu cheese and carmelized onion and it was pretty good. My husband got a pizza and he said it was just OK.  The next time we tried it we ordered food to take to our suite. I ordered our food, a burger and a club sandwhich with avocado and no mayo on anything and 2 side salads with dressng on the side; and sat in the bar while I waited. The waitress came out twice after taking my order to confirm it since she didn't write it down. That was fine with me.  I was glad she was so determined to ensure everything was right. However, when I got back to the room, there was mayo on everything and dressing all over one salad and no dressing on he other, not even on the side. Boo.

This bar is at the Tahiti Village resort. The bar itself was ok, not remarkable, but the bartender, Jessica, made it a favorite last stop after a day on the strip. She was professional, friendly, fun and went out of her way to make us feel special and right at home. I would recommend this bar to anyone because of her. Looking forward to our next trip to Vegas.

Been here for almost 50 minutes only one drink, food order was lost, manager brought us chips and salsa for inconvenience,  but we are still waiting, our first and last time here. Not happy with service as noted by other users no one has any motivation to offer good services.

We came here at 12, they close at 2. First they took forever to help us, when we order drinks the server who was not very bright said they didn't have the beer we were asking for when I clearly see it on draft. I had to show her, she puts in our order and we added another shot and she screams to the bartender I need another shot and the bartender proceeds to say "really another one"and the server within feet of us says "yes I know it's not my fault the just order it". So we decide to order wing because we see them still bringing out food. When we asked our server she said "ah ya that's over" instead of I'm sorry our kitchen is closed. Or let me check if we can do that". Beside the fact that it's before the 1 o'clock time she said they were closing the kitchen. Wow what services!

This place needs new management. I don't have anything good to say. First off, the table we sat at was dirty. I needed to ask the waitress to wipe it. Next, my wife and I ordered dirty martinis and the drink was mostly olive juice. It was by far the worst martini I've tried. We ordered the calamari and it was something worse than average frozen calamari you get from the market. The side of sauce was barely enough for about half the order. The sauce wasn't good. When we asked for more, they brought out another side. I decided to try the calamari with a side of ranch dressing. It made the calamari taste a little better. We asked for the bill and when it came, we noticed we got charged for the side of sauce. Lol. I've never seen a charge for a side of any kind of sauce but I guess there's a first time for everything. There's a Denny's in the same parking lot. Better off going there.

Cool little open air tropical restaurant/bar, located just off the lobby of Tahiti Village, overlooking the pool area. Just opened 2 weeks ago, and had better selection, and was more reasonably priced than I expected. 

They have lettuce cups, crab cakes, specialty pizzas, fish and chips, Mac and cheese w/ roasted ham (looked cheesy and tasty), salads, quesadillas, etc. All priced $8-13.

We tried the fish & chips, lettuce cups (I got shrimp, but think chicken might be better), garlic fries (so tasty) and chicken tenders, and they were all quite good. Check it out!

Food A
Service D

Sloooooooooooow.  Waitress took her sweet time getting our menus, food, and check which has 20% added as gratuity - which explains why service is poor, there is no incentive to do well.

We arrived to tahiti village and decided to eat here since it was right on the resort.  We got seated right away.  The restaurant wasnt busy.  The waitress was friendly and kept checking on us.  Everything was a good portion size.  We ordered 2 regular burgers, 1 spicy burger (jalapeno), 1 turkey club sandwhich and 1 nachos with beef.  Everything came out fairly quickly,  And every thing was good. The spicy burger had a real good kick to it.  All the burgers were a good size.  My boys both 7 were not able to finish theirs.  Usually they can finish a whole burger but they were busy nibbling on the nachos first.  The nachos was enough for all of us to share.  I wasnt able to finish my club so i saved the other half for later.  We also made it during happy hour 2-5pm, so both our draft beers were only 2.50.  Besides our happy hour beer, I think everything else was a bit pricey.

Worst service I've had in a long time. Sign said seat yourself so we did. 10 minutes later we were still waiting to be greeted. A few minutes more and finally she asks for a drink order as she tosses menus at us. I give her our order and she quickly makes sure we know it's not happy hour. Ok. She asks if we are ready to order-I just got the menu -no! She brings the drinks and she asks for an order. I'm still not ready she comes back in 2 min. No not ready. I didn't see her for ten minutes now I see her all over me. We got our food in reasonable time with no napkins and no silver wear. My husband got up and grabbed bar napkins. Still no silver wear. She came to check on us. I asked for a spoon (thinking she would notice we didn't have any) she literally brought one spoon back -my hubby & I shared the spoon! Terrible. Didn't ask to get another drink for us. Ugh! Never be back

BEWARE!!!!! This place has crappy service since they know that they AUTOMATICALLY get 20% gratuity.  I was ready to leave my generous 10% tip after they ignored me a few times when I know the waitress saw and heard me call for her. This really irritates me. There was only 1 waitress and the restaurant was understaffed. AND knowing this it upsets me that they have it in the tiniest print that there is an automatic 20% gratuity...

Went as owners at Tahiti Village, ordered some burgers and beers to go. Peeved that they charge 20% upfront, for an order of 3 people only.  We were served our beers immediately, but didn't pay any mind, thought our burgers would come soon. It took half an hour for a restaurant that was only moderately busy. At least the chef came out an apologized for the wait. Our beers got warm as a result of waiting for our food, so we asked for fresh cold ones. Bartender got snippy and said they serve beer all the time and no one asks for it with their food, we should have asked. Had we known how slow their service was, maybe we would have. The waitress comes over and apologizes to us, snippy bartender scolds the waitress, and waitress further apologizes to us in Spanish this time. Out of nowhere, BARTENDER HAS THE AUDACITY TO TELL HER FRONT OF US THAT WE'RE JUST UPSET OVER THE 20% TIP, as if we couldn't afford their $76 dollar bill for 3 burgers and 3 beers. Sarcastically, Bartender tells us to have a nice day as we leave.

The food here is just ok, my burger I ordered well done, came out burnt looking like a hockey puck. 

What was really annoying is the slow slow service, and it wasn't even busy! Good thing we weren't in a hurry, but it's just annoying. This place could really be something if they wanted it to be, but for now, it's disappointing.
Drinks were terrible.  I mean really awful. The egg rolls were disgusting, super greasy. The burger was ok. The two stars were for the waitress who was delightful and gave good service.
Food was decent,  service was horrible.  Some servers just stand around staring for a while and some have no customer service skills at all...

Stayed at Tahiti Village for a friends wedding for 5 days. 17 South was awesome!! The drinks and food were delicious! Not to mention the staff, especially Christina, was amazing! I had injured myself 6 weeks prior to my visit and was in a cast and knee scooter. Not very ideal when on vacation nor attending a wedding. However Christina made my visit a nice experience. She was super friendly, very helpful, and very attentive to anything me or my friends needed. I can't wait to return fully healed and really get to enjoy my visit! Kudos to Christina and the staff at 17 South! I highly recommend to drink Clear Blue Sky and always have your tavern frys with the garlic butter and parmesan. Cheers!
The most pathetic menu ever only 5 choices at all on the tiniest hard to read menu. Ok place for drinks not if you are hungry.

Worst place ever- We went here because we are staying at their resort. Service was Terrible!! We ordered 1 garden salad and 1 chicken Salad. Took forever to get our meals(2 Salads, Really?) Ordered a drink that was nasty! The Chicken on the salad tasted like it was old, and the lettuce was soggy. The garden salad was average. The waitress was more interested at serving the table next to us 4 times before finally acknowledging us. We have 20 people flying in this week to stay at the resort here and will make sure to let them know not to waste there time or money here.
Bartender is miserable and acts like she is totally overwhelmed when the bar is empty. If you don't like being in the customer service business, don't be a bartender . Thank you.

Overpriced for what you get. I got the CBA which is chicken bacon and avocado. 

Chicken had zero seasoning. I hate French fries generally and they were the best part of the meal. 

Waitress was slow, no water refills. Don't come here unless you are dying of hunger and can't crawl to the Denny's in the parking lot.

Good food, nice server-- prompt with refills. I had a chicken quesadilla, my husband had a pizza. Both meals were decent sized (we had leftovers) and tasted great. We would definitely head back here for a bite. One thing to note-- the gratuity is included in your check (20%).

This place was just ok.  The drinks were good but expensive happy hour was the best time.  The staff was nice and polite.  The food was bar food.  I ate here twice during my stay at the resort.  It's very convenient.

Wings were good, fries were good, CBA was good, nachos were good! Service was baaaaaadddd. They have an ideal spot for a bar with screens etc. Slow seating slow water messed up bill etc. kinda sucks. Wanted it to be great. Good service would change it to 5 stars.

I expected a plain boring bar and grill in this resort but was EXTREMELY surprised. The CBA sandwich (chicken bacon avocado) was excellent. Good bread, crispy bacon, tasty marinated chicken and the fries were good with salt and pepper I added. However, the highlight was a 24 year old waitress named Holly very recently transplanted from the northeast who has some top-notch mixed drink skills. Her Mai-Tai beats the best I've had, and that's after trying them for 27 years to find one as good as the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Oahu or Bob Chinn's Seafood restaurant near Chicago. And to top it off, Holly then makes the best Long Island Iced Tea I've had, shattering a 20 year record, and even my own attempts to make them. Good hire, 17 Degrees!!

I stayed at the resort for 5 days and went here twice. I give it the two stars because the food was decent. It looses the other three because of their 20% automatic gratuity. I don't mind on food so much but on drinks that is ridiculous. The average mixed drink is $9-$11. That means you are tipping $1.80-$2.20 per cocktail. Even worse, their "Happy Hour" which includes some well drinks, domestic drafts and food charges 20% on the full amount before the half off. Basically you can have two cocktails and chicken fingers for $16.00 before tax, not bad right?? Until you see you just had to tip $6.40 or at the rate of 40%. As an owner of this timeshare, I think I have paid enough without being forced to tip more than the average person would. They need to get rid of the automatic gratuity on the alcohol, it is the biggest scam I have ever seen. If you are that desperate for money, charge more for the drinks and food. Just be aware before you go so you don't experience sticker shock. There is not currently a sign posted or a notation on the menu telling you about this. You find out when you get the bill.

The food could of been better, I asked for crinkle cut fries with my meal and I got regular fries, it didn't really bother me but they need to listen and write down things better, the thing that pissed me off, is that I had a coupon for a free tiki glass and they wanted to charge me $10 for glass when I had the coupon in hand and it said free, oh and tried giving me a salad that I didn't order

We enjoyed the service and the drinks had great consistency, some places make the same drink different every time but not here. Plus you can take them out to the pool! The food was exactly what you would expect from a bar and grill but a bit better. The Caesar salad was surprisingly good! Can't wait to go back in October

We were there visiting back in February and had the best service.  CHRISTINA* was our server.  She was very attentive and treated us like stars.  When you go make sure to ask to for Christina.  She will make your visit the best and can recommend some of the best things to eat on the menu!
The fish and chips are disgusting!  The batter was under cooked and runny. She asked for a "fix" and the chef said "sorry it is just what the batter is today". Gross

17 South: where the ribs are not as good as home and your hungry sixteen-year-old gives a it a grade of C.

 'Nuff said.

We stayed at the Tahiti Village during CES. The hotel does offer a shuttle, but when in Vegas, it's inevitable that your feet will hurt and you will get tired and you will be sucked into eating at your hotel. If you are staying at the Tahiti Village you will have one choice - 17 South.

Though I usually try to avoid 3 stars while on vacation (Yelp snob), my feet hurt too badly to argue with a star rating. My husband and I ordered some sort of alcohol, a hamburger, sweet potato fries, and the Island Chopped Salad. For Vegas, the prices seemed reasonable for the portion sizes. And the food was fine. 3 stars? Yeah. Probably so. The burger tasted good, but had a weird sort of frozen meat after taste. The chicken in the salad was also poor quality. Sort of like the type of chicken you would expect to find in a salad pulled out of a freezer in a gas station. Meat quality aside, the meals were prepared nicely and had nice flavor. The stars of the show were the sweet potato fries. Definitely get those. In fact, just get those. 

If you are stuck in the hotel and tired, 17 South will do. But there are clearly far better restaurant options in Vegas.

The food is less than mediocre at best. Service really had no personality. Considering this is at a big resort you would think they would step it up and bring in a better chef to re do the menu. It is obvious why there was only two tables other than us on a Saturday night. Disappointing...

Food is your basic bar food.  They have a good selection of draft beer and they have video poker.  Service here is pretty crappy unless you sit at the bar.  I guess when 20% is automatically added, there's no motivation to do a good job.  I hope they do away with automatic gratuity.  I don't mind tipping 20-30% for great service, but 20% for shitty service really chaps my ass!

Gets a one stat bump because the manager stepped up and comped our entire meal and drinks.

It was a Saturday night at dinner time and place was half full should have been the warning. We ordered salmon which was served to us raw and Chopped salad with extra chicken came with no chicken. 

Ordered ballast point pale ale which tasted like a Heineken. Two very distinctly different tasting and looking beers. She insisted it was the pale ale. 

45 minutes to bring food and never checked in on us as we wanted a refill.

We stayed at the Tahiti Village this time on our Vegas vacay and this is the restaurant located on the premises.  What a nice surprise it was!  Usually, the restaurants located within timeshare properties are not great.  This one was extremely good.  The waitresses we encountered were all extremely friendly and I had some of the best cocktails I have ever had here (another surprise since this place looks like a little diner).  Food was really good too.  Very fresh salads, great sandwiches and reasonable pricing.  Service can be slow but not excruciatingly so.  There are some slot machines present too but I never saw anyone using them so I am not sure if anyone ever gets lucky enough to hit a jackpot.  The view on the patio is wonderful.  You feel like you are anywhere but Las Vegas (think Hawaii, Punta Cana, anywhere tropical).  Highly recommend if you are in the vicinity.  Denny's is next door and I recommend skipping Denny's and popping in here instead.

What can I say.....if you want BASIC, this is the place for you! My family and I stay here at least 4 times a year and this place has progressively gotten worse. Please DON't waste your time and money on this place. You can easily walk to the Denny's on the property and get some grub that taste 100 times better. FYI  the service is awful!

We came here for dinner tonight. We ordered pizza and appetizers. The live music was wonderful. But my favorite part of the night was our server, Jessica. She made us feel like VIPs and like we were no trouble at all... Even though our group was high maintenance. Thank you! We will be back!
Food was good. Got a pepperoni pizza and put it in the hotel refrigerator, the next day it was still cheesy and good after microwaving. Fries and wings were also delicious along with the nachos.

It was just ok.  I had the ahi tuna burger and it wasn't bad, I was relieved that it was not dry and completely overcooked.  My husband had the steak sandwich and didn't care for it all that much.  

I had a drink there and it was pretty good...something sweet with mango in it , wish I could remember the name of it.  

The service was hit or miss.  Everyone was pleasant, just not all that attentive.  Once they delivered the meal they didn't come back to check on us.  I asked for ketchup and extra sauce for the tuna burger when they brought the meal, but that took forever to get - my husband actually had to get up out of his seat and flag her down, and I was almost done with my meal by the time she returned with it.

Cocktail Menu was tempting, but listed no prices, so I just drank water, as I planned to have a Cocktail @ Sunset.  

Chicken Avocado Sandwich ($13) was Ok, as was the Island Chopped Salad ($14) ~ different ingredients that meshed.  

Limited Menu offers a handful of Entrees.  Hundreds of Pizzas are served to Tahiti Village Guests in 5 Towers, so that keeps it in the black.  

Employees moved like they were on "Island Time" ~ maybe they don't realize that even though most Patrons are @ leisure, they still expect prompt service after they sit down, & follow-up between setting down the plates & presenting the check.  Like cold food? sauces, drink refills, etc.  Poor service irks Diners, as Servers always expect Tips, regardless of whether they earn them.  

Coordination & communication between Chef, Kitchen, Servers, is lacking.  These issues never seems to change.  

There are Gaming Machines inside.

It's not even busy. Waiting for food forever. Only 1 waitress at 3:30pm. In addition, for a place entertaining pool side clients, seats should not be made of fabric and velvet cushions. My ass is so wet as I text this review at this moment...

We ate here 2x( lunch and dinner) because we were given a 50.00 credit from the timeshare.  For lunch I ordered a turkey club with no ham and no tomatoes.  I stressed the NO tomatoes a couple times.  I also asked 2x for ranch.  The sandwich was full of tomatoes and when I got back to the pool, no ranch.  I ordered a slice of choc. cake and carrot cake.  Both were HORRIBLE.  The chocolate cake was frozen solid.  The carrot cake did not even have a cream cheese frosting( some god awful fake buttercream).  

Dinner was equally unappetizing.  I had a salad that had the spiciest bacon I've ever tasted.  The tiniest pieces of mango too.  My wife a pile of nachos with fake liquid plastic cheese.  Enough said.

OMG.  My lunch was so fresh and delicious.   Def will be back.  Check it out
We also had a delicious chocolate cake.  Locals....lots of specials
